summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council recalls its previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity. The Council expresses deep concern over the deteriorating security and humanitarian crisis in eastern DRC due to the 23 March Movement's (M23) ongoing military activities. It strongly condemns the M23's resumption of attacks, including the entry into Goma on 20 November 2012, and demands the group's immediate withdrawal, disarmament, and the restoration of State authority. The Council also condemns human rights abuses, including violence against children and sexual violence, and calls for perpetrators to be held accountable. It demands an end to external support to the M23 and requests the Secretary-General to report on allegations of such support. The Council also calls on the International Conference on the Great Lakes Region (ICGLR) to monitor and investigate reports of outside support to the M23.
